intro: Buchholzia, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Africa, with several species found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plants are characterized by their woody stems, alternate leaves, and showy flowers that often have five petals. Buchholzia species are typically shrubs or small trees, and some are used in traditional medicine. The genus includes species such as Buchholzia acuminata and Buchholzia madagascariensis.
